channel.title: BUbreakingSectionTwo
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from BUbreakingSectionTwo, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Federal judge clears key hurdle for Trump and Musk’s government employee buyout plan
item.description: The Boston-based judge's order in the challenge filed by a group of labor unions was a significant legal victory for the Republican president after a ...

item.title: Trump’s Call with Putin, and Ozempic’s Effect on Drinking
item.description: Plus, the hidden cost of a Valentine’s bouquet.

item.title: Trump-Putin Call Was ‘No Betrayal’ of Ukraine, Hegseth Says
item.description: The call has raised concerns among some European leaders that Ukraine could effectively be sidelined in any peace negotiations.

item.title: How Trump Is Gutting Regulatory Agencies Like the SEC, CFPB and EEOC
item.description: The furious pace of deregulation is gutting agencies intended to protect ordinary Americans, consumer advocates say. But business groups have long fav...

item.title: Aid agencies rush supplies into Gaza as fragile cease-fire holds for now.
item.description: Hamas said that mediators between the two sides were working “to remove obstacles and close gaps” after the cease-fire deal hit a roadblock.

item.title: Unilever warns of a ‘subdued’ start to 2025 as ice cream triple-listing looms, knocking investor confidence
item.description: “Consistency is not about one good year. We know there is a lot still to do," Unilever CEO Hein Schumacher said.

item.title: Between Russia and Elon Musk, German Voters Face a ‘Dual Front’ of Disinformation
item.description: In the first major European vote since President Trump’s re-election, influence campaigns are targeting Germany from two sides.

item.title: Senate confirms Tulsi Gabbard as Trump’s intelligence chief as GOP falls in line—except for one senator
item.description: Gabbard is an unconventional pick to oversee and coordinate the country's 18 intelligence agencies, given her past comments sympathetic to Russia.

item.title: Elon Musk wants to tear out entire federal agencies: ‘It’s like a weed. If you don’t remove the roots, the weed will grow back’
item.description: Musk said the action of "deleting" entire agencies is necessary to prevent future administrations from rehiring what he believes are unnecessary roles...

item.title: Driver Arrested After Car Crash at Demonstration in Munich
item.description: Several people were injured in the incident, the police said. They have not said whether the crash was an accident or a deliberate attack.

item.title: Warming Trend in U.S.-Russia Relations Leaves Ukraine in a Tough Spot
item.description: Trump’s recent moves, including a conversation with Putin and a demand for Ukrainian mineral rights, are worrisome signs for Zelensky.

item.title: Ken Griffin says he is ‘so appreciative’ of Elon Musk’s DOGE cuts but slammed Trump’s tariffs, saying they’re ‘what you do in the death throes of a nation’
item.description: The Citadel CEO said Trump’s tariffs will have “a permanent and adverse effect.”

item.title: Warming Trend in U.S.-Russia Relations Leaves Ukraine in a Tough Spot
item.description: Trump’s recent moves, including a conversation with Putin and a demand for Ukrainian mineral rights, are worrisome signs for Zelensky.

item.title: Aid agencies rush supplies into Gaza as fragile cease-fire holds for now.
item.description: Hamas said that mediators between the two sides were working “to remove obstacles and close gaps” after the cease-fire deal hit a roadblock.

item.description: In the first major European vote since President Trump’s re-election, influence campaigns are targeting Germany from two sides.
